page.title: 19Schoolboy Howlers, Tongue
page.content: Children regularly produce, quite unin tentionally, some very funny sentences and here are a few I have collected. 'The Indian wore a very colourful turbine.' 'Kenneth stuck his finger in the marmalade and then ate it.' 'Can you draw an equatorial triangle?' 'Bristol is the name of a town on the west handed side of England.' 'When wind takes up moisture from the sea it is called rising damp.' 'The Loch Ness Monster is an illusive creature.' 'He walked barefoot through the streets of Canterbury and confused his sins at the altar.' 'Shakespeare was an inspired poet when he was alive.' 'In summer you can go on picknecks.' 'The man had a handicap of four feet.' 'Bigger mortgage sets in after death.'
